snippet.textDisplay: I haven't had a perm since elementary school, and I never intend to perm my children's hair. Perms did nothing but break my hair off and burn my scalp. My beautician did not GAF. Literal torture. Curly is better anyways imo 🤷🏾‍♀️

snippet.textDisplay: The burns don’t show up right away.  When you get home you start to feel the scabs.  Looks can be deceiving also she didn’t show Anything.  I got perms from the age 3-33.  I’m 8 years removed natural.  The things I fell for now you couldn’t pay me to do again. FUCK THAT. Going natural for me was an investment into ME. If you don’t have time for it fine but I got time for me and doing it the right way.  Wearing it in puffs we get it sis.
snippet.textOriginal: The burns don’t show up right away.  When you get home you start to feel the scabs.  Looks can be deceiving also she didn’t show Anything.  I got perms from the age 3-33.  I’m 8 years removed natural.  The things I fell for now you couldn’t pay me to do again. FUCK THAT. Going natural for me was an investment into ME. If you don’t have time for it fine but I got time for me and doing it the right way.  Wearing it in puffs we get it sis.

snippet.textDisplay: Omg do not do a relaxer on freshly washed hair and DEFINITELY don’t blow out your hair first. That makes micro cuts on your scalp and the oil from unwashed hair protects your scalp. You will burn your skin right off by doing that.
snippet.textOriginal: Omg do not do a relaxer on freshly washed hair and DEFINITELY don’t blow out your hair first. That makes micro cuts on your scalp and the oil from unwashed hair protects your scalp. You will burn your skin right off by doing that.

snippet.textDisplay: anyone know the difference between keratin and relaxers? lol i had a keratin treatment last month to straighten my hair and got me wondering what the difference is

snippet.textDisplay: Perms are so unhealthy. As a black woman who used to get perms all throughout my childhood they were literally torture. It felt like I was going to pass out and my head would explode. I finally decided to stop and just embrace what I have and use protective hairstyles. Perms have really harsh chemicals and damage the hair over time. Yes the hair is super silky and smooth but it is like a slow death for the hair over time. Heat to me is just as bad for black hair but the chemicals are a different monster. No one should be using perms in 2020 just my opinion. It's okay to want straight hair but there are so many other ways to obtain it without the damage.
snippet.textOriginal: Perms are so unhealthy. As a black woman who used to get perms all throughout my childhood they were literally torture. It felt like I was going to pass out and my head would explode. I finally decided to stop and just embrace what I have and use protective hairstyles. Perms have really harsh chemicals and damage the hair over time. Yes the hair is super silky and smooth but it is like a slow death for the hair over time. Heat to me is just as bad for black hair but the chemicals are a different monster. No one should be using perms in 2020 just my opinion. It's okay to want straight hair but there are so many other ways to obtain it without the damage.

snippet.textDisplay:
Grrrrrrrrrl. I LOVE NATURAL HAIR. I watch natural hair transformation videos ALL 👏🏻 THE 👏🏻 TIME 👏🏻
Deeper Than Hair TV is my favourite.. but I have neeeever watched a hair relaxing video until now. I used to sit in the bathroom and watch my housemate relax her beautiful curls and I thought it was a tragedy..
My hair is naturally fine, soft, bone straight and won’t even told a hair tie, let alone a curl.. y’all curly haired people are BLESSED.
snippet.textOriginal:
Grrrrrrrrrl. I LOVE NATURAL HAIR. I watch natural hair *transformation videos* ALL 👏🏻 THE 👏🏻 TIME 👏🏻
*Deeper Than Hair TV* is my favourite.. but I have neeeever watched a hair relaxing video until now. I used to sit in the bathroom and watch my housemate relax her beautiful curls and I thought it was a tragedy..
My hair is naturally fine, soft, bone straight and won’t even told a hair tie, let alone a curl.. y’all curly haired people are BLESSED.

snippet.textDisplay: Brad Mondo, yes you! I dont appreciate what your addictive videos has done to my daily routine. Everytime I come on youtube to look for an information about a how-to-videos, I end up watching hours of your satisfying interesting funny videos. By the way, you are by far the only white stylist I will ever allow to my beautiful, stubborn, unrulling, spoiled 4c short-medium lenght and semi full hair ever. Yes I said it! By the way its so obvious that you are a amazing down to earth beautiful person inside out. Your videos are so relaxed and natural. Yeah yeah, I know I'm being judgmental and yes I'm a freaking Virgo. A well-known bs detector. From what I've seen so far you have little to none  ❤️❤️❤️

snippet.textDisplay: The truth is that none black or none mixed people shouldn’t use relaxers. People think that it’s good for any kind of curls. Then they use it and their hair quickly falls out and they blame the relaxer. Pretty much if someone doesn’t have nappy or tiny tight natural curls, then they shouldn’t use it. People don’t understand black people products. Tons of people think that they can use any hair products. Then they grab the relaxer with a black lady or a black girl on the box/container, use it and their hair falls out. Then they get mad/blame the company or relaxers.
snippet.textOriginal: The truth is that none black or none mixed people shouldn’t use relaxers. People think that it’s good for any kind of curls. Then they use it and their hair quickly falls out and they blame the relaxer. Pretty much if someone doesn’t have nappy or tiny tight natural curls, then they shouldn’t use it. People don’t understand black people products. Tons of people think that they can use any hair products. Then they grab the relaxer with a black lady or a black girl on the box/container, use it and their hair falls out. Then they get mad/blame the company or relaxers.

snippet.textDisplay: Satisfaction is destiny
snippet.textOriginal: Satisfaction is destiny

snippet.textDisplay: As someone who has had their hair relaxed about once a year for 16-ish years....it never gets old and is always a trip! I swear when I get home after getting it relaxed it feels like I'm wearing a wig lol. Honestly, I've never actually researched the relaxing process so I'm interested to click on the links you provided. I do know that in all the years I never had a stylist comb through my hair while applying the relaxer except for this last time and let me tell you the end result was amazing! It lasted so much longer but the wild thing is that my grow out, my natural hair, is SO much straighter and less curly/frizzy then before!!! I could see how some people who actually like their natural curl could be majorly upset by this....but personally I am so not mad at it! lol
snippet.textOriginal: As someone who has had their hair relaxed about once a year for 16-ish years....it never gets old and is always a trip! snippet.textDisplay: I think I started getting the evil god awful hotcomb at 3 and probably got my 1st relaxer at 7 and kept it until I was 20. I for real had no idea what my hair texture was going to look like because it was straightened my whole life and for black children atleast your hair as a baby never looks the same as an adult or even a child. I'll never go back though once I watched the movie "Good Hair" and realized what I was putting in my head. But being natural is a lot of work. I do wigs when I want a different look

snippet.textDisplay:
Some tips that only black hairstylists will tell you:
1. DO NOT WASH YOUR HAIR 48-72 HOURS BEFORE
2. No caffeine 24-48 hours before you relax your hair ( it opens your pores and makes the relaxer burn)
3. Do not scratch your scalp 48 hours prior. You’ll open up little lacerations and the chemicals will get in them. Major chemical burn.
4. Don’t relax over already relaxed hair. It’ll break off.
Happy relaxing!
snippet.textOriginal:
Some tips that only black hairstylists will tell you:
1. DO NOT WASH YOUR HAIR 48-72 HOURS BEFORE 
2. No caffeine 24-48 hours before you relax your hair ( it opens your pores and makes the relaxer burn)
3. Do not scratch your scalp 48 hours prior. You’ll open up little lacerations and the chemicals will get in them. Major chemical burn. 
4. Don’t relax over already relaxed hair. It’ll break off. 
Happy relaxing!

snippet.textDisplay: Its also not wise to comb hair before strighting...cause combing pulls on the hair roots and breacks the sclap...and when the relaxer goes on it its gonna "burn"...plus ur whole head does not have the same type of hair...like mine the back is 4a and the front is more 4c...so its never "really" gonna be the same all over...

snippet.textDisplay: Thanks for the video. I honestly thought you would be condescending, but you went there with an open mind. I think a hairstylist relaxed 4 or 5 times in my life. I'm 40, and I would never ever do it myself. 9 years that I wear long natural hair. It's a political statement and a choice I have made for my health. Why would I risk my hair life to look more like a White person? I agree with you that it is one of the harshest treatments you can do to your hair. And people do it so casually. I'll never let my daughter do that by herself. No, no, no. You will cry tears of blood when your hair will break or fall.
snippet.textOriginal: Thanks for the video. I honestly thought you would be condescending, but you went there with an open mind. I think a hairstylist relaxed 4 or 5 times in my life. I'm 40, and I would never ever do it myself. 9 years that I wear long natural hair. It's a political statement and a choice I have made for my health. I'll never let my daughter do that by herself. No, no, no. You will cry tears of blood when your hair will break or fall.

snippet.textDisplay: I lived in a predominantly black area and have super curly hair and hated it. My friend said I should just put a relaxer on my hair so at 10 yrs old me and her got some just for me relaxer and put it in my hair (starting on the scalp). I remember it burned so bad but she said it was normal. When we were done my scalp was burned so bad it was wet because it was weeping puslike stuff and my hair was coming out in chunks. It was a disaster! My scalp had burns and bald spots all over. I learned that day relaxers arent made for me.
snippet.textOriginal: I lived in a predominantly black area and have super curly hair and hated it. My friend said I should just put a relaxer on my hair so at 10 yrs old me and her got some just for me relaxer and put it in my hair (starting on the scalp). snippet.textDisplay:
Definitely no hair washing or scratching before hand, the relaxer shouldn't touch the scalp just as close to the hairline as possible, don't apply the relaxer all the way to the ends until the very end, and use a neutralizing shampoo.

I'm so happy you did this video! a stylist who want to learn more about other textures/cultures, we love to see it! ❤️
snippet.textOriginal:

snippet.textDisplay:
Brad! A gurl needs help here!!
I TRY to look stylish every day, and I do what I can with my hair. Bur that is the point....
I have to lie in bed for 70 to 90% of the day, because of a condition called EDS.
If I lift my arms too high, my shoulder will pop out (Yea, REALLY, happens every day with all my joints)
If I have to hold a blowdryer, my fingers will get in SO much pain..

So, I know it seems impossible to think of something, but that's why I asked you :) You like a challenge, right? ;)

Also, I have straight hair, cut to about bra-band-length, and recently got cut a bang, sweeped to my right.. (I'm sorry .. not that good at english)
Oh and I'm 24 years old, so not really into the "oh but you're sick so why bother anyway?"-look. I'm alive. I wanna look good. I wanna get some volume in my flat hair.


LOVE to look at your video's to let the day get by faster ♥️ It's like we're almost friends :)

X
snippet.textOriginal:

I TRY to look stylish every day, and I do what I can with my hair. Bur that is the point....
I have to lie in bed for 70 to 90% of the day, because of a condition called EDS.

If I have to hold a blowdryer, my fingers will get in SO much pain..

So, I know it seems impossible to think of something, but that's why I asked you :) You like a challenge, right? ;)

Also, I have straight hair, cut to about bra-band-length, and recently got cut a bang, sweeped to my right.. (I'm sorry .. not that good at english) 
Oh and I'm 24 years old, so not really into the "oh but you're sick so why bother anyway?"-look. I'm alive. I wanna look good. I wanna get some volume in my flat hair.


LOVE to look at your video's to let the day get by faster ♥️ It's like we're almost friends :) 

X

snippet.textDisplay: Brad, I understand that you're thinking about sections a lot but the science to getting relaxed hair is simple.  Get the cream EVERYWHERE and smooth it out. How you smooth the hair is all up to you. Twisting the hair in little buns is in no way a problem if it has been smoothed with the back of a comb or some other tool. It's also really hard to damage type 4 virgin hair.
snippet.textOriginal: Brad, I understand that you're thinking about sections a lot but the science to getting relaxed hair is simple.  Get the cream EVERYWHERE and smooth it out. How you smooth the hair is all up to you. Twisting the hair in little buns is in no way a problem if it has been smoothed with the back of a comb or some other tool. It's also really hard to damage type 4 virgin hair.

snippet.textOriginal: That’s not true... having the hair straight down may have a chance of the chemical touching your sensitive skin like face, neck and ear where you can get a severe burn

snippet.textDisplay: I know you dont add relaxwre on fresh washed hair because your scarl is so fragile... but listen I still did it back t ack then because I was impatient.  I use to  relaxe , wash/ blow dry and then add Ion color with 30 dev.  I'm lucky because I never had any damage hair or hair falling out. But Ive been naturel now since 2013... I will never use relaxer ever again... too much work lol

snippet.textDisplay:
We have neutralizing shampoo in the relaxer pack the "pink conditioner" as you called it is actually pink oil moisturizer, just a way to put moisture back into the hair where the relaxer dried it out
Edit: also in the African American community it's actually quite common to hot comb or relax or hair stressing at an early age. My adoptive mom was white and knew nothing about my hair and I've been taking care of my own hair since I was 8. My hair was halfway down my back but my mom convinced me to go to a salon for a relaxer, cut and style. The salon tech overproccessed my hair, cut my hair up to my cheekbones, tried to replace my hair with wefts, and ultimately changed my hair texture and wave pattern. It's never grown anywhere near as long since. And I don't know how to manage it now. I'm considering cutting it off and starting new but I'm scared because I've only been bald twice, once during a cancer scare and once when I let my hair stay in a ponytail for too long and it matted together. Wish me luck, love you always!!!!
snippet.textOriginal:
We have neutralizing shampoo in the relaxer pack the "pink conditioner" as you called it is actually pink oil moisturizer, just a way to put moisture back into the hair where the relaxer dried it out
Edit: also in the African American community it's actually quite common to hot comb or relax or hair stressing at an early age. My adoptive mom was white and knew nothing about my hair and I've been taking care of my own hair since I was 8. My hair was halfway down my back but my mom convinced me to go to a salon for a relaxer, cut and style. The salon tech overproccessed my hair, cut my hair up to my cheekbones, tried to replace my hair with wefts, and ultimately changed my hair texture and wave pattern. It's never grown anywhere near as long since. And I don't know how to manage it now. I'm considering cutting it off and starting new but I'm scared because I've only been bald twice, once during a cancer scare and once when I let my hair stay in a ponytail for too long and it matted together. Wish me luck, love you always!!!!
